fields.headline: Ins and outs
fields.bodyText: David White has been appointed new chief executive of Norfolk county council replacing Tim Byles, who is the new chief executive for the government's Partnerships for Schools programme. White left his position as managing director of Thurrock council in July. Caroline Fowles is taking on the joint role of chief executive of Swindon primary care trust, and group director for housing for Swindon council. She was previously chief executive of Cheltenham and Tewkesbury primary care trust. Jonathan McWilliam is to become the director of public health for Oxfordshire county council and Oxfordshire primary care trust. He was a consultant specialising in primary care and mental health services. Ben Kernighan has been promoted to the new position of deputy chief executive at the National Council for Voluntary Organisations. He was the NCVO's director of services and development. Tracey Reddings will remain at the Charities Aid Foundation (Caf) instead of joining Baring Asset Management to head its charity services, as previously announced. Reddings will retain her former position as executive director of CAF's charity financial services.
